content: In the following problems, you will be given a series of propositions as premises and a proof obligation. The premises are in the form '(1) xxx. (2) xxx. (3) xxx. ...', and the proof obligation is in the form 'Prove: (n) xxx.' You need to provide the minimal set of premise propositions such that the proof obligation can be derived from the given premises. You should present the result in the form '(1),(2),(3),...->(n)', where the propositions on the left side of the arrow are separated by commas and represent the premise numbers, and the right side of the arrow represents the proof obligation number. Please ensure that the propositions on the left side of the arrow are presented in the order of their introduction in the proof process, meaning each proposition's introduction must be consistent with the derivation process (for example, the first two propositions might derive an intermediate conclusion, which then can be combined with a third proposition for further derivation). The answer should only be in the form '(1),(2),(3),...->(n)' without any additional text.(Notice that If the same reasoning premises have their labels and content reassigned, the two reasoning processes should remain consistent in content, with only the labels changed.)

Premises: [(1) Every impus is a wumpus. (2) Yumpuses are impuses. (3) Yumpuses are not fast. (4) Every jompus is metallic. (5) Each rompus is dull. (6) Sterpuses are not shy. (7) Each impus is not sunny. (8) Vumpuses are yumpuses. (9) Grimpuses are numpuses. (10) Lorpuses are temperate. (11) Each shumpus is large. (12) Grimpuses are not amenable. (13) Jompuses are shumpuses. (14) Numpuses are not opaque. (15) Every yumpus is a sterpus. (16) Each lorpus is a lempus. (17) Brimpuses are not brown. (18) Every vumpus is a brimpus. (19) Grimpuses are jompuses. (20) Impuses are rompuses. (21) Each vumpus is earthy. (22) Each jompus is a vumpus. (23) Fae is a lorpus. (24) Fae is a jompus.] Prove: (25) Fae is not sunny.

The minimal set of premise propositions to derive (25) Fae is not sunny. from the given premises is:

(1) Each impus is a wumpus
(2) Yumpuses are impuses
(3) Impuses are rompuses
(4) Each jompus is a vumpus
(5) Vumpuses are yumpuses
(6) Fae is a jompus

Using these premises, we can infer that Fae is a wumpus.

From (1), (2), and (3), we can infer that Fae is a wumpus and a rompus.

From (4), (5), and (6), we can infer that Fae is a wumpus and a jompus.

Finally, from (7) of the given premises, we can infer that Fae is not sunny.

Therefore, the proof obligation (25) Fae is not sunny can be derived from the given premises: (1)-(7).

Premises: [(1) Fae is a jompus. (2) Fae is a lorpus. (3) Each jompus is a vumpus. (4) Each vumpus is earthy. (5) Impuses are rompuses. (6) Grimpuses are jompuses. (7) Every vumpus is a brimpus. (8) Brimpuses are not brown. (9) Each lorpus is a lempus. (10) Every yumpus is a sterpus. (11) Numpuses are not opaque. (12) Jompuses are shumpuses. (13) Grimpuses are not amenable. (14) Each shumpus is large. (15) Lorpuses are temperate. (16) Grimpuses are numpuses. (17) Vumpuses are yumpuses. (18) Each impus is not sunny. (19) Sterpuses are not shy. (20) Each rompus is dull. (21) Every jompus is metallic. (22) Yumpuses are not fast. (23) Yumpuses are impuses. (24) Every impus is a wumpus.] Prove: (25) Fae is not sunny.

根据给定的前提，可以得出以下推理：

(1) Fae is a jompus
(2) Fae is a lorpus
(3) Jompuses are vumpuses
(4) Vumpuses are earthy
(5) Impuses are rompuses
(6) Grimpuses are jompuses
(7) Vumpuses are brimpuses
(8) Brimpuses are not brown
(9) Lorpuses are lempuses
(10) Yumpuses are sterpuses
(11) Grimpuses are numpuses
(12) Shumpuses are large
(13) Numpuses are not opaque
(14) All shumpuses are not shy
(15) All rompuses are dull
(16) All jompuses are metallic
(17) Yumpuses are not fast, nor impuses
(18) Impuses and wumpus have nothing in common (proof 24)

由于给出的前提没有提到关于Fae和阳光之间的关系的信息，所以不能得出结论说Fae是不sunny的。因此，根据给定的前提无法证明 (25) Fae is not sunny。
